title: Vivaldi: Venice in splendour
creator_contributor_role: Victorian Council for Children's Films and Television, distributor
description: Episode of Series "Music maestro". Despite suffering chronic illness for much of his life, Vivaldi must be credited as one of the most prolific composers of all time. Estimates show that he wrote more than 500 concertos, including the much-performed 'The Four Seasons'. This program, narrated by conductor/composer David Palmer explores the life and times of one of the world's greatest composers. Included are performances of some of his works by internationally renowned artists: 'The Four Seasons', 'Oboe Concerto RV 461', 'Flute Concerto La Notte', 'Viol D'Amore Concerto RV 393', 'Bassoon Concerto RV 472', 'Piccolo Concerto RV 455', 'Concerto for Two Mandolins' and more...
